comment: Great professor! She is super engaging and does LOTS of examples. She gives homework that is good practice for exams and makes sure you have an idea of what the exams will look like before you take them.

Prof. Lowder was an amazing Dynamics professor. She walks through several examples. Quizzes are slightly changed HW problems. Tests are not bad if you do and understand the homework. Honestly, she is one of the most caring professors I know and has tons of side stories that make the class not so mundane!! Strongly recommend. Drops lowest quiz grade

Dr. Lowder loves teaching and loves her students. that said, her lecture style didn't click with me. She kind of expects you to be familiar with the material before you get to lecture, and she spends the class more or less guiding students through the problems. It felt inefficient to me and I was constantly losing my train of thought during class.

A very good professor. She learns everyone's names day one. She lectures well and works examples in class. She is very available outside of class. She grades very quickly with great feedback. Her grading is pretty easy and very generous as long as you are on the right track. She is definitely a top notch professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: If you want a professor to take Dynamics with, this is the one. I feared this class, hearing how much people struggled with it, but she made the process a piece of cake, even during the whole virus situation. The grade was based off of 3 tests worth 40%, 4 quizzes worth 25%, homework worth 15%, and a final worth 20%. Highly recommend for ENGR 3122.

Phenomenal professor, all reviews are correct. Perfect explanations of problems, always answers any questions you have. 4 quizzes, 3 tests, we had HW due every time we had a quiz or test, it helps to complete the HW. Test & quiz questions are fair. One of the most structured/ organized classes Ive taken.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Lowder is hilarious and does a great job of making class engaging and applicable. The course content was fairly difficult but if you follow along in class and do the homework, you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Lowder is one of my favorite professors. If you're struggling, email or go see her. She will know your name and always cuts up in class. She does a wonderful job making sure you understand what's going on, and really cares. DON'T Chegg your homework, actually use it to study for tests and exams and you'll be fine!

Dr. Lowder is willing to  help. If you don't understand something make sure you ask, she will explain every detail. She is nice and funny, her lectures were mostly from power points that were provided but would always do the problems on the board. Her grading is true to the syllabus.

Dynamics is a tough class, and she does everything she can to help you understand it.  If you give a good effort and actually do the homework, you can come away with a good grade.  She is a very good teacher.

Dr. Lowder is an excellent professor with a Ph.D.  From Georgia. She used to be the absolute best professor of the year while she was teaching at Atlanta Metropolitan College .Her priority interest is to help the students succeeded. I would strongly advise to take her for any class she teaches.

I took her dynamics last semester. She is amazing! She can remember every student's name just after one or two classes. Mostly, she uses PPT to lecture. She is very nice, humourous, patient. Sometimes we ask silly questions but she is still happy to answer. One of the best female professors in engineering department!

At the end of the semester before the final and set to make an A in the class. She posts her notes online including the problems worked in class. The quizzes and tests are out of the book. As long you do the homework, which is collected for a grade, you will do good on the quizzes and tests.
